excerpts:
The service is so friendly

Nothing cures a hangover like their super breakfast burrito.
This weekend I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito with a little bacon
super breakfast burrito.author: Manny F.
super breakfast burrito.review:
This is my go-to Taquería; I'm still eating here at least once a week. If anything the food is getting better and better. The service is so friendly

Nothing cures a hangover like their super breakfast burrito.

Literally everything is good here and over the years I'm pretty sure I've tried everything. This weekend I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito with a little bacon and it was amazingly good.

****5/24/08*****

I eat here a couple times a week so I guess I like it. It went under new management about a year ago and the food quality has improved greatly. The boss is a nice lady and the women that work there are as sweet as sugar. Try ordering in Spanish if you can, they'll get a kick out of it.

excerpts: I tried the veggie burrito and a bean and cheese burrito.
That's what i usually get there.
bean and cheese.author: Cynthia B.
bean and cheese.review:
What i like about this place is that opens early.  Food is ok.  Good for the price (cheap).  I tried the veggie burrito and a bean and cheese burrito.  That's what i usually get there.  They weren't fantastic, but they were ok.  

A cheap place to eat.  Nice staff.  Some people like this place more than El Farolito at 24th and Mission, but I strongly disagree.  

Anyways, El Faro is good place to grab a burrito in the AM.

excerpts: I think I would've been better off with a bean and cheese burrito.
It's quite long and good sized.
The few small pieces of what made it a carne asada burrito actually took away from the burrito itself.
I couldn't really taste the carne asada.
The beans, rice, sour cream, and guac just fit all together.
The salsa tasted more like store bought.
The chips were a little stale.
Overall, a good sized burrito, tasty for "vegetarians".
bean and cheese.author: Arnold W.
bean and cheese.review: As I'm eating this, all I can think is how smooth this carne asada burrito was. I think I would've been better off with a bean and cheese burrito. It's quite long and good sized. The few small pieces of what made it a carne asada burrito actually took away from the burrito itself. I couldn't really taste the carne asada. The beans, rice, sour cream, and guac just fit all together. The salsa tasted more like store bought. The chips were a little stale.Overall, a good sized burrito, tasty for "vegetarians".

excerpts: Regular burrito with chicken, refried beans and rice (no salsa).
Burrito is fresh, but bland.
I don't eat raw onions, thus why I opted for no salsa fresca, but this burrito needs "something".
regular.author: Angela E.
regular.review: Regular burrito with chicken, refried beans and rice (no salsa). Burrito is fresh, but bland. I don't eat raw onions, thus why I opted for no salsa fresca, but this burrito needs "something".

excerpts: The regular burrito has rice and the taqueria has cheese.
regular.author: Jenny A.
regular.review:
MMM This place is good, definitely different from San Jose burritos but good nonetheless. 

It's a more watery type burrito, so the juices will be dripping down your hands as you eat it. It could use a dash of heat and a hint of lime and that would be perfect.

The regular burrito has rice and the taqueria has cheese. I chose the taqueria cause I loveeeeeerssss cheese. 

We came here mostly cause there was a ScoutMob on this place (50%) order made our 2 burritos equal the price of one, good deal. 

IDK if I would come back though because I'm not huge on juicy burritos and I would like to have cheese AND rice in my burrito. BUT overall, the food was good, and even better the next day when microwaved for a minute and consumed with a fork and knife, YUM.

excerpts: Go with the Pinto beans, guacamole if you like that muck (not for me), and get the hotter salsa with some of the regular salsa.
regular.author: Dean C.
regular.review:
I'm pretty mission-oriented when it comes to eating Mexican Food. I will go to one particular place because they have ONE particularly good item. Everything else is just a waste of ink or crusty restaurant lighting--I don't even bother with asking.

El Faro (San Francisco) has THE best Carnitas Super Burrito. Go with the Pinto beans, guacamole if you like that muck (not for me), and get the hotter salsa with some of the regular salsa. This burrito smacks the others around with a heavy hand (they are heavy with the Carnitas.)

El Farolito, ehhh...
La Morena, OHH-VERR-RAY-TED
Every other burrito place (often imitating, never duplicating)

The secret is the sauce they put in after they've loaded everything else.

I give this place a 4 stars because there is no refill on the Horchata. God, that Horchata is good, I need a swimming pool of that stuff. But the good part is, they have glass-bottled Mexican Coke. Strangely it shouldn't, but it does KICK the ASS off American coke. Glass bottle, real sugar, all the stuff soda used to be. It's catching on again (finally), even my local 7-11 in Daly City carries the stuff.

Better have sharp eyes if you need to use the restroom, there is nothing lit back there! Parking is a tad harder because of the new complex where the old parking lot used to be. If you happen to be disappointed in the food, it's probably because you didn't follow my directions on what to order. Serves you right.

excerpts: Sure enough he was seating in the back on a regular chair with a walker.
The  guy looks the same, I asked about the other heavy set guy who owned the place, The guy passed away about 10 yrs ago.
Burritos were watery no flavor, just not the same.
Nothing last forever.
The bakery across the street gone, Jerry's tattoo shop, and the old Mi Rancho supermarket gone.
regular.author: Oliver M.
regular.review:
Ok, so this is my 1st official yelp review. I've thought of yelping for years now, but haven't gotten around to doing it. I guess it's time for you folks to hear me out now.

I hate to start off on the negative side, but I have to keep it real. I've read most of the    Reviews of people who say they have been coming to place the last 40 yrs or so. I agree with some saying it was the worlds greatest carne asada burrito. Something about that flavored meat, the tasty rice, melted cheese and all that good stuff. As a child I went to George Moscone elementary k-5 right next door which is now John Oconnel High. the schools switched sometime long ago Fr Harrison st. Anyways I went back about a month ago, 25 yrs or so longing for the great carne asada taste. Pretty weird feeling after all these yrs the place looked the same. I was actually looking to see if this old heavy set guy who always sat on a stool was still there. Sure enough he was seating in the back on a regular chair with a walker. The  guy looks the same, I asked about the other heavy set guy who owned the place, The guy passed away about 10 yrs ago. Burritos were watery no flavor, just not the same. Nothing last forever. The bakery across the street gone, Jerry's tattoo shop, and the old Mi Rancho supermarket gone. Sorry El Faro , but it's not the same. 

For you other folks if you like the food that's good for you, but if your from the old days you know what I'm talking about.

excerpts: I grew up in the Mission District and used to go to El Faro on a regular basis for fast and tasty Mexican food.
Luv their breakfast burritos.
Cheap eats!!!
regular.author: Raider J.
regular.review: I grew up in the Mission District and used to go to El Faro on a regular basis for fast and tasty Mexican food.  Luv their breakfast burritos.  Cheap eats!!!

excerpts: I used to get the regular nachos on almost a weekly basis.
Everything else I tried was mediocre at best.
Burritos often were lukewarm and unexciting.
They don't serve beer, which was not such an issue since I was usually taking my food back to my place to enjoy, but be aware.
If you're not in the mood for nachos, go elsewhere (i.e., Los Jarritos)
regular.author: Amy K.
regular.review: Here's the scoop - or at least this was the case when I lived less than a block away - the nachos kick butt! I used to get the regular nachos on almost a weekly basis. Everything else I tried was mediocre at best. Burritos often were lukewarm and unexciting. They don't serve beer, which was not such an issue since I was usually taking my food back to my place to enjoy, but be aware. If you're not in the mood for nachos, go elsewhere (i.e., Los Jarritos)

excerpts: Three stars for their regular burritos.
They're good, but I think you can find less expensive burritos that are just as good or better in the Mission.
El Faro is a great neighborhood Mexican restaurant with a friendly staff and good food.
regular.author: Sara H.
regular.review: Five stars for their breakfast burrito.  I love 'em.  Three stars for their regular burritos.  They're good, but I think you can find less expensive burritos that are just as good or better in the Mission.  El Faro is a great neighborhood Mexican restaurant with a friendly staff and good food.

excerpts: I always get a super burrito.
I consider it among the best in the bay area.
If you don't know any Spanish it may be difficult to order changes as many of the affected reviewers seem to demand.
I take what they make and its good.
With a cold beer or a soda its worth it.
They have a clearly written menu describing what is in the particular dish.
I cannot comment on the other meals because I am addicted to their super pork, beef, or chicken burritos.
I said super, you have to get all the trimmings added to make them nice and juicy.
The negative comments here are not justified but the result of poor education and upbringing from BAS-s.
(bay area slobs)
If you are dissatisfied, make your own Mexican food.
Or go to Taco Bell.
a good place too for fast food.
super.author: Andrew B.
super.review:
I lived in the mission near El Faro and went there from time time. The owner was a customer of mine in the real estate market and wanted to expand to a sit-down restaurant on Polk St. I encouraged him to keep a good thing going and he explanded El Faro into the financial district. It lasted a few years and now they are down to El Camino and the original Mission location.
      Business has been slow due to competition and at one time there were 6 or 7 employees turning out the orders. I always get a super burrito. I consider it among the best in the bay area. If you don't know any Spanish it may be difficult to order changes as many of the affected reviewers seem to demand. I take what they make and its good. With a cold beer or a soda its worth it. They have a clearly written menu describing what is in the particular dish. I cannot comment on the other meals because I am addicted to their super pork, beef, or chicken burritos. I said super, you have to get all the trimmings added to make them nice and juicy. The negative comments here are not justified but the result of poor education and upbringing from BAS-s. (bay area slobs) If you are dissatisfied, make your own Mexican food. Or go to Taco Bell. a good place too for fast food.

excerpts:
Split a super breakfast burrito   

Eggs

Ham
Bacon

Black beans

$10

No salsa bar

super.review:

Eggs

$10

No salsa bar

excerpts: However just a couple of weeks ago a friend of mine was in Concord Ca , told me he knew how much I love El Faro burritos & would pick me up 4 Super Burritos ,

When he arrived at my home which is in Nevada ,I was very disappointed , The beans looked from a can smashed up not whole , no flavor at all , the chicken was very small portion the rice was terrible and most of all I wanted extra Jalapenos like always order at El Faro in the mission .
TO THE NEW OWNERS
SOMEONE GET OVER
TO CONCORD
LOCATION ASAP
BECAUSE THEY ARE RUINING THE 50 PLUS YEARS OF A GREAT RESTAURANT !!
super.author: Anthony M.
super.review: I grew up in the mission and was fortunate to know the original owners of El Faro , I have had their food for decades always top notch !  However just a couple of weeks ago a friend of mine was in Concord Ca , told me he knew how much I love El Faro burritos & would pick me up 4 Super Burritos , When he arrived at my home which is in Nevada ,I was very disappointed , The beans looked from a can smashed up not whole , no flavor at all , the chicken was very small portion the rice was terrible and most of all I wanted extra Jalapenos like always order at El Faro in the mission .  TO THE NEW OWNERS SOMEONE GET OVER TO CONCORD  LOCATION ASAP BECAUSE THEY ARE RUINING THE 50 PLUS YEARS OF A GREAT RESTAURANT !!

excerpts: The carnitas is super in anything
and I highly recommend the shrimp soft tacos.
super.author: Jeanne H.
super.review: Consistently awesome food and friendly service.  I have been eating here a few times a month for a couple years and have never once had a disappointing "bad day" burrito (which is something I can't say about any of my other favorite Mexican restaurants).  Prices have remained affordable, making it one of the only under-$10 lunch spots within an easy walking radius.  The carnitas is super in anything and I highly recommend the shrimp soft tacos.

excerpts: We order the usual super burrito for our son and two Mexican sandwiches for ourselves.
The woman making the food was someone we'd never seen before and was the only person behind the counter making food.
The only other person there was a man running the register who said he was the Manager.
She didn't know how to make the food we've been buying for years.
The burrito was rolled very loose and the sandwiches were not made according to their usual standards.
Mind you, we hadn't bought them yet.
super.author: Bobbie T.
super.review:
My husband and I have been going to El Farro in the Mission since we were teenagers, over 20 years.  Since we don't live close to them, and have to drive a bit to get there, we considered them a special treat.  We decided yesterday was going to be the day.  We drive across the city to pick up dinner only to be greeted with the worst experience ever, anywhere.

We order the usual super burrito for our son and two Mexican sandwiches for ourselves.  The woman making the food was someone we'd never seen before and was the only person behind the counter making food.  The only other person there was a man running the register who said he was the Manager.  She didn't know how to make the food we've been buying for years.  The burrito was rolled very loose and the sandwiches were not made according to their usual standards.  Mind you, we hadn't bought them yet.  We saw this by watching her make the food through the glass.

She didn't understand what we were asking her to do, like not put our lettuce on the hot grill to prevent wilting, or to make one spicy and the other not.  So we spoke to the "Manager", or attempted to anyway.  He ignored us, wouldn't acknowledge we were talking to him, until my husband got loud.  Then he proceeds to say "it's just a sandwich".  We argued that because we're customers paying for "just a sandwich", it should be made the way we want it, the way it's always been made in the past, citing hot lettuce as an example.  His response... "lots of people do it that way".   I was absolutely stunned that he didn't care the food wasn't being made according to their usual standards, or that the customer is saying it isn't right.  He absolutely did not care, stood there shrugging his shoulders and again said "geez, it's just a sandwich, don't have a heart attack over it".  

My response... I'm having a "heart attack" because you act like you don't care and that makes you look like an a@#hole that doesn't care about your customers.  He agreed he didn't.  with that said, we vowed to never return and made sure he knew he was loosing good, long time customers.  We'll never go back.  

The food is good, don't get me wrong.  But I can't spend my hard earned money in a business that could care less about the customer, and be so open with it.  He thought the food was fine, didn't care that the burrito would fall apart, or that the lettuce was served hot in a sandwich.  In his opinion it was fine and that's all there was to it.

It may be "just a sandwich", but it's that sandwich, and that burrito, and that taco that pays your bills buddy.  No customers, no money.  No money, no business.  It's simple.  Take care of your customers, especially those who've been with you for more than 20 years.  They don't deserve to be in business treating people that way.

excerpts: Papusas were not great, but it's super fast and cheap because it's ready-made.
They have both cheese and pork with cheese.
Each one is a pretty filling size.
The super burrito was okay, but really mushy with the refried beans.
There wasn't much meat.
Would be good for someone who just got their teeth worked on at the dentist.
The enchiladas are also okay, but these are on the small side.
super.author: Jennifer W.
super.review:
Good place for a quick and easy meal. Service is good. It had a neighborhood feel to it. No tourists here. Plenty of seating at any given time, but good for take out too. Credit card charges for $5 and above. Large bottled drink selection from the fridge.

Papusas were not great, but it's super fast and cheap because it's ready-made. They have both cheese and pork with cheese. Each one is a pretty filling size. The super burrito was okay, but really mushy with the refried beans. There wasn't much meat. Would be good for someone who just got their teeth worked on at the dentist. The enchiladas are also okay, but these are on the small side. Horchata was good.

Overall, food is okay, but service is good.

excerpts: With so many options available El Faro might not seem like anyone's first choice, but when combining super saver deals like ScoutMob then El Faro jumps to the top of my list.
When paying for a "Super" burrito I would expect something grand, yet I was able to finish mine to completion in a matter of minutes.
super.author: Kevin J.
super.review:
With so many options available El Faro might not seem like anyone's first choice, but when combining super saver deals like ScoutMob then El Faro jumps to the top of my list.

The service was friendly and quick.  No one was in line before me which was a bit concerning but I had missed the lunch rush by about an hour.  The decor inside wasn't anything special.  One large buffet type counter with menu above and staff waiting patiently for you to either place your order or learn Spanish.  The choices are limited but with the addition of black beans and grilled chicken I was a happy camper for the moment.  My burrito was wrapped to go and upon unveiling of my post lunch time meal my dry burrito was pretty wet.  As Ruggy J. mentions, the condensation from the heated tortilla and tinfoil caused a soggy mess making it difficult to eat.  Not to mention the inside being a bit too juicy for my comfort.  When paying for a "Super" burrito I would expect something grand, yet I was able to finish mine to completion in a matter of minutes. No sir I wasn't a pig this day.

As noted above - my special deal was the reason for the visit and when only paying $3+ for a drink and burrito I can't complain too much.  2.5 stars for this Lighthouse.

excerpts: In the early 70s I would drive from Orange County to bring back a few super burritos to my follow Marines.
That being said, today's El Faro's is a bit of a disappointment.
Still a great burrito but not the outstanding burrito
it once was.
Did they invent the San Francisco?
I don't know
but now El Faro's super burrito is now just a good place to go.
Is that why there are no longer a few stores open?
Please bring back the quality they had when the big guy was there
I truly miss that great big super chicken of the past...
I would rate it at 3 stars but the memories of the best burrito in the world give it a extra star.
The burrito of my home the Mission no longer shines as much as it did.
Tomorrow, Toto's Pizza a main stay of the Mission till the fire in 1969 now only south of the city but still has great pizza, review tomorrow.
super.author: Howard D.
super.review: I have been going to El Faro's for many years. In the early 70s I would drive from Orange County to bring back a few super burritos to my follow Marines. That being said, today's El Faro's is a bit of a disappointment. Still a great burrito but not the outstanding burrito it once was. Did they invent the San Francisco? I don't know but now El Faro's super burrito is now just a good place to go.  Is that why there are no longer a few stores open? Please bring back the quality they had when the big guy was there  I truly miss that great big super chicken of the past... I would rate it at 3 stars but the memories of the best burrito in the world give it a extra star. The burrito of my home the Mission no longer shines as much as it did. Tomorrow, Toto's Pizza a main stay of the Mission till the fire in 1969 now only south of the city but still has great pizza, review tomorrow.

excerpts:
Other things to note: 
- Their super burritos include ingredients that other places charge extra for, like sour cream and guacamole
- Their churros are soft on the inside, a bit crispy on the outside, and coated in just enough sugar (but not too much)
- There is always available street parking
so you don't need quarters for the meter.
I haven't had a plate here, but honestly, I can't resist getting anything but a carne asada super burrito or an Acapulco
super.author: Mariela D.
super.review:
I've been coming here for well over 10 years and their quality is still the best, their burritos are still huge, and they still have that same Mission ambiance I grew up with that I love so dearly.

They are the only place that makes real Acapulco burritos  ($8.99 with prawns, rice, crab salad spread, red and green bell peppers). The smaller "Farolito" taquerias make their own version of them but they are not the original. I also can't leave without having horchata (rice milk drink with fresh ground cinammon, vanilla, splash of lime) - it has been one of my favorite drinks in the world since I was little. Ahhh, I'm getting nostalgic!

Other things to note: 
- Their super burritos include ingredients that other places charge extra for, like sour cream and guacamole
- Their churros are soft on the inside, a bit crispy on the outside, and coated in just enough sugar (but not too much)
- There is always available street parking so you don't need quarters for the meter. 
- They always give you free chips and salsa

I haven't had a plate here, but honestly, I can't resist getting anything but a carne asada super burrito or an Acapulco burrito because it's what they do best.

I came in today and I noticed they recently moved the soda machines to behind the counter in order to create more seating space. Win!

Tip: Credit card requires a minimum $5 charge.

excerpts: Back then, the Super burritos were a lot cheaper (and you got more meat)...
super.author: Working M.
super.review:
Having eaten at this location for the past 35 years, I can say I have noticed a marked changed in the burritos. Back in the early 80's...they assembled the burritos differently...they used to spread the sourcream, gaucamole and cheese on the tortilla skin and then add beans, rice and meat. Now it's all mixed togather so the taste is not as even as it was before. 

The meat portions are much smaller than before too. Now the burrito is mostly beans and rice. Back then, the Super burritos were a lot cheaper (and you got more meat)...but still...at least put some meat into those "little burro's" or call it something else.

So Yes...I have tasted better...at this location some location35-25 years ago.

excerpts: My husband and I are openly obsessed with their chorizo (or super with ham and bacon for the husband) breakfast burritos.
super.author: Autumn B.
super.review:
My husband and I are openly obsessed with their chorizo (or super with ham and bacon for the husband) breakfast burritos.  I am not sure what kind of magic is put into these, but it's what brings me back every time.

I add refried beans to mine (YUM) and he goes for double rice no beans.  The sauce that goes over the whole thing is probably a big factor in the magic. 

Definitely recommend this place.  They serve breakfast burritos all day which is especially great for weekend sleep in days.

Now I'm hungry just thinking about these.

excerpts: The super burrito with steak is pretty good.
It comes with salsa and some chips.
Service is fast and efficient.
Their pupusa is good.
The Horchata is good.
They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.
super.author: Hiroshi K.
super.review: This place makes good burritos.  The super burrito with steak is pretty good.  It comes with salsa and some chips. Service is fast and efficient.  Their pupusa is good. The Horchata is good.  They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.  They have standard menu of burritos with choice of meats,   nachos, tacos, sandwiches, horchata, and pupusas. They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.  I would come to this place again.

excerpts: Chicken super burrito was indeed super.
super.author: Michelle S.
super.review:
Confused workers and stale chips. No bueno.

Aside from that, the chicken tamales were pretty good, but it doesn't come with tamales sauce unless you order the entrée.

Chicken super burrito was indeed super.  It will fill the biggest of appetites.

There are better choices in the city, so I don't think I will be back any time soon.

excerpts: They aren't super friendly behind the counter and their prices are on the steep side.
Overall, a weeeeak performance in a region of the city famous for good burritos.
super.author: Desmo K.
super.review:
The burritos are crap.  They don't even try to drain water off of the beans - they just slap that mess in with some gristly nasty cold meat and let you pick the grossness out of your mouth as you try to eat it.  Even with ScoutMob, I feel ripped off.  They aren't super friendly behind the counter and their prices are on the steep side.  Overall, a weeeeak performance in a region of the city famous for good burritos.  They should throw these guys out and open another El Burrito Express here.

Yuck!

excerpts: 4 Super Chicken's Please!
super.author: Michael K.
super.review:
I have been eating these burritos for 35 years!  When we moved out of California to Atlanta; El Faro's is always on the top of our list when we come visit.

In fact we usually fly into San Francisco and our family has them waiting in the car for us at the airport.  

My Gringo Wife even fell in love with the place and she grew up on yuppie food!   Now   my kids love the place and have been eating them from shortly after birth.

When the family comes to visit us in Atlanta they swing by El Faro's with a insulated bag and fill in up with burritos to fly us out to Atlanta.

4 Super Chicken's Please! The staff is always very nice and the steamed tortilla is what makes El Faro's unique.

I don't usually take the time to write reviews, but I started to read some of these 1 star reviews and I would recommend for those people to stay at Chipotle (BTW is owned by McDonalds what do they know about burritos?)

If you can even keep a Chipotle burrito down after eating stay away from El Faro's because you would not be able to handle all the flavor and authenticity!

excerpts: so it's super tender and the rice is always light and fluffy.)
It's fair to say I've seen them add a bit too much guac or sour cream to the center of a burrito, or not drain enough juice from the meat, but they are always responsive when I make requests
and I can't remember a time I wasn't satisfied with my order.
I will note that the chips were way better in the 90's, back when there was the parking lot with a giant mural across the street, just saying.
super.author: Zan T.
super.review: My family and I have been coming to this specific El Faro for years. It's a great spot to get a quick, no-nonsense meal. I think they've perfected their steak and rice and they also make great "no meat" burritos. (The chopped steak soaks in juice so it's super tender and the rice is always light and fluffy.) It's fair to say I've seen them add a bit too much guac or sour cream to the center of a burrito, or not drain enough juice from the meat, but they are always responsive when I make requests and I can't remember a time I wasn't satisfied with my order. I will note that the chips were way better in the 90's, back when there was the parking lot with a giant mural across the street, just saying.

excerpts: It's overpriced ($2 more than standard for the area, for a super burrito)
super.author: Zachary R.
super.review:
This review of one star may be a bit harsh, considering I ate it all, and it was acceptable, which is normally good for two or three stars in my world.  But it is simply the worst taqueria I've been to in the Mission, and there's no reason to settle for it when there are so many MUCH better options within even two square blocks.  It's overpriced ($2 more than standard for the area, for a super burrito), it's tortillas are steamed, not grilled, they don't melt the cheese, they charge extra for random things without telling you, and the staff appears more surly than even the low bar for this kind of restaurant.  

If you're considering going here, look for a place with better ratings, or just keep walking down the block.

I was thinking of something positive to say, but they don't have a TV, they don't have good Agua Fresca, they don't have nice seating.........nope, I've got nothing.  Nothing at all that distinguishes them in a good way.

excerpts: The "Super
" Burrito ive found is mostly filler (rice & beans) with a 'sprinkling' of your favorite meat (non vegi)
super.author: Bruce G.
super.review:
these days they have become overly 'pricy' and very much smaller portions.  Having tried many items on there menu. Taste..nothing special here, rather normal/plain tasting overall. The "Super" Burrito ive found is mostly filler (rice & beans) with a 'sprinkling' of your favorite meat (non vegi) they ladle some liquid/juice to make the buro juicy.

Did i mention...they charge extra for everything!!!! GOOD GRIEF!!! So if your busy watching how they build your order & you want extra anything, be prepared for ..."ThatsExtra!!"

...back in the day (over15yrs ago) their food used to taste awesome with large portions and cheap prices for the masses. Seems Capitalism leads the way here over great food at good prices. (Sad)

...would i recommend it? NO! 
There are handfuls of great authentic Mexican food places smattering the Inner Mission, better food & portions to treat your pallet and without 'price shock' after especially if your a good sized man wanting to get full!!

excerpts: but I just didn't like how  mushy and liquidy the super carnitas burrito was.
super.author: Allyson L.
super.review: It was only okay because I was really hungry. It wasn't too bad but I just didn't like how  mushy and liquidy the super carnitas burrito was.

excerpts: I still remember when my mom used to stop by here on her way home for work and bring home a super burrito.
It was the delicious.
They had the best carne asada meat.
When I was old enough to drive, me and my cousins used to go her all the time to get a super burrito.
I went there not too long ago and was very excited to bite into an El Faro super burrito since I haven't had one for years, but soon did I realize it wasn't the same.
For a minute there, I thought I was in the wrong taqueria.
The burrito was below average.
It felt like someone just took away a part of my childhood.
super.author: Ricky M.
super.review:
I'm saddly disappointed.  This used to be my #1 taqueria in SF (for a long time) when I was a kid.  I still remember when my mom used to stop by here on her way home for work and bring home a super burrito.  It was the delicious.  They had the best carne asada meat.  When I was old enough to drive, me and my cousins used to go her all the time to get a super burrito.

I went there not too long ago and was very excited to bite into an El Faro super burrito since I haven't had one for years, but soon did I realize it wasn't the same.  For a minute there, I thought I was in the wrong taqueria.  The burrito was below average.  It felt like someone just took away a part of my childhood.  I spoke to the cashier briefly and discovered that the the present owners aren't the same from the years past.  

Hmmmm, that's too bad.  Bring back the old El Faro...please.

excerpts: By fare my favorite super burrito's Ive ever had period!
And I have had allot of burrito's (my favorite food).
I will kill for one of these burrito's!
Ask for extra gravy!
it's what makes their burrito's!
Biggest problem is that they are not open late.
This place is also considered one of the first places to serve a super burrito in SF!
super.author: Brandon W.
super.review: By fare my favorite super burrito's Ive ever had period! And I have had allot of burrito's (my favorite food). I will kill for one of these burrito's! Ask for extra gravy! it's what makes their burrito's! Biggest problem is that they are not open late. This place is also considered one of the first places to serve a super burrito in SF!

excerpts:
The service is so friendly

Nothing cures a hangover like their super breakfast burrito.
This weekend I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito with a little bacon
super.author: Manny F.
super.review:
This is my go-to Taquería; I'm still eating here at least once a week. If anything the food is getting better and better. The service is so friendly

Nothing cures a hangover like their super breakfast burrito.

Literally everything is good here and over the years I'm pretty sure I've tried everything. This weekend I ordered a grilled chicken super burrito with a little bacon and it was amazingly good.

****5/24/08*****

I eat here a couple times a week so I guess I like it. It went under new management about a year ago and the food quality has improved greatly. The boss is a nice lady and the women that work there are as sweet as sugar. Try ordering in Spanish if you can, they'll get a kick out of it.

excerpts: I get the super burrito without guacamole.
It is huge (hard to finish one myself, but I'm wanting more when I try to split it).
Never a long line like other burrito shops, and prettty easy to park.
Better than El Farolito and better than Taqueria Cancun, although Taqueria Cancun beats it late night bc it stays open after the bars, while El Faro closes pretty early.
Get it with the refried beans.
I'll have to try that Prawn burrito others are talking about.
They also have the Coke in the bottle.
super.author: Jessica S.
super.review: I agree with Dean C that this is one of the better Carnitas burritos in the Mission, although it is not always consistent. I got one the other day and I thought it was the best burrito in the Mission (along w my bf) then I got one yesterday, and it was pretty soggy.  I get the super burrito without guacamole. It is huge (hard to finish one myself, but I'm wanting more when I try to split it). Never a long line like other burrito shops, and prettty easy to park. Better than El Farolito and better than Taqueria Cancun, although Taqueria Cancun beats it late night bc it stays open after the bars, while El Faro closes pretty early. Get it with the refried beans. I'll have to try that Prawn burrito others are talking about. They also have the Coke in the bottle.

excerpts: I usually get the carne asada super burrito with the "spicy" salsa.
It's a good medium heat.
super.author: Ryan S.
super.review:
This place is around the corner from where I work so I go there fairly frequently. I don't think I've had anything other than the Burritos, so bear that in mind. That said the Burrito's are pretty darn good. I'm still not entirely sure about steaming the tortillas. To me to the tortilla should be heated up on the grill. Regardless, they are good. I usually get the carne asada super burrito with the "spicy" salsa. It's a good medium heat. The burritos are to big for me to finish in a single sitting, and that's A-OK with me. 

If you've got a craving for a burrito the size of your head and are in the Mission this is a pretty good place to go.

excerpts: El Faro (San Francisco) has THE best Carnitas Super Burrito.
super.author: Dean C.
super.review:
I'm pretty mission-oriented when it comes to eating Mexican Food. I will go to one particular place because they have ONE particularly good item. Everything else is just a waste of ink or crusty restaurant lighting--I don't even bother with asking.

El Faro (San Francisco) has THE best Carnitas Super Burrito. Go with the Pinto beans, guacamole if you like that muck (not for me), and get the hotter salsa with some of the regular salsa. This burrito smacks the others around with a heavy hand (they are heavy with the Carnitas.)

El Farolito, ehhh...
La Morena, OHH-VERR-RAY-TED
Every other burrito place (often imitating, never duplicating)

The secret is the sauce they put in after they've loaded everything else.

I give this place a 4 stars because there is no refill on the Horchata. God, that Horchata is good, I need a swimming pool of that stuff. But the good part is, they have glass-bottled Mexican Coke. Strangely it shouldn't, but it does KICK the ASS off American coke. Glass bottle, real sugar, all the stuff soda used to be. It's catching on again (finally), even my local 7-11 in Daly City carries the stuff.

Better have sharp eyes if you need to use the restroom, there is nothing lit back there! Parking is a tad harder because of the new complex where the old parking lot used to be. If you happen to be disappointed in the food, it's probably because you didn't follow my directions on what to order. Serves you right.

excerpts: I like to complement my pollo super
burrito with some chocolate milk... mmmm.
super.author: Michelle B.
super.review:
I've been coming to this place since I was a fetus and I'm hoping that they have an El Faro in heaven too because this place is awesome =)

To me and mi familia, nothing beats an old school El Faro burrito... They're massive and filled with flavor. I like to complement my pollo super  burrito with some chocolate milk... mmmm. The burritos are so juicy that you have to be careful not to leave any burrito evidence on your clothes. 

The restaurant itself has looked the same all of my life and i truly appreciate its consistency! So it's not fancy and maybe it doesn't cater to demanding non-Latino sensibilities, but it leaves some charm in between all of the mission's renovated buildings. Eat in your car if the orange and brown colors are that bothersome... the point is, just eat one of their awesome burritos!

and yeah... the pupusas are pupusarific! The Latino Day parade is coming up and I can't wait for my El Faro visit!

excerpts: Super Carnitas  Burrito!
- nuf said.
super.author: Derik P.
super.review:
This is my debut review - so for me, nothing else is more deserving than El Faro on 20th and Folsom (The other EF locations just don't seem to have the same effect on me).  Aside from steamed rice...Mexican food just happens to be my favorite food...and I have been a deep fan of this place since the age of 5.  

I've been living far far away from El Faro and city for a while now...and its not uncommon for me to take that 45 mile trek just for a Super Carnitas  Burrito!  - nuf said.

excerpts: not "Home of the Super Burritos".
(Please!)
super.author: Bernadette F.
super.review: Me and My Family won't be going there again after11/19/11. Tried to charge 2.50 for extra meat,Are u Serious?  At the same time burritos look like long ass corn rolls not "Home of the Super Burritos". (Please!)

excerpts: The burritos are really small for a "super burrito" and costs $8.34 for something that's not super filling.
Though the texture of the burrito isn't great, the flavors actually do make up for it.
The only thing in the burrito that has a decent non-liquidy texture are the jalapenos.
Still, what tipped me off, for this terrible review of their restaurant, was the service.
There were three or four employees inside.
It was around 6:40 pm, and the sign posted said that they closed at 7.
So I knocked on their door to get their attention that I was a customer and wanted food.
The old guy (I think was the boss) stares at me, and just ignores me.
Then, the three female employees looked up at me, and also ignored me, making clear that they saw me.
I pounded on the door, at least waiting to at least speak to them, or hint that they were closed.
But no, they just ignored me, doing their thing.
I thought they would at least be courteous enough to at least speak/gesture to me.
What ticked me off, was their lack of respect for their customers--I truly felt like just flipping them off for their rudeness.
Next time, I'm going on Mission St. to find a place with manners and better food.
super.author: Steven Z.
super.review: I've been here a few times in my life, and about ten years ago (when I was five), I remember eating their burritos, and liking them. Quite frankly, now, the burritos are sub-par, the wettest burritos I have EVER eaten. They only use refried beans, sour cream, cheese (mozzarella, I think), jalapenos, a bit of hot sauce, rice (no salsa), extremely watered down guacamole, and the meat they use is loaded with liquid in itself. When I eat the burrito, I literally have to slurp the contents to eat it. Also, they steam the tortillas, which I found kind of absurd, making the burrito somewhat flimsy, requiring the tin foil to support it. The burritos are really small for a "super burrito" and costs $8.34 for something that's not super filling. Though the texture of the burrito isn't great, the flavors actually do make up for it. The only thing in the burrito that has a decent non-liquidy texture are the jalapenos. Still, what tipped me off, for this terrible review of their restaurant, was the service. There were three or four employees inside. It was around 6:40 pm, and the sign posted said that they closed at 7. So I knocked on their door to get their attention that I was a customer and wanted food. The old guy (I think was the boss) stares at me, and just ignores me. Then, the three female employees looked up at me, and also ignored me, making clear that they saw me. I pounded on the door, at least waiting to at least speak to them, or hint that they were closed. But no, they just ignored me, doing their thing. I thought they would at least be courteous enough to at least speak/gesture to me. What ticked me off, was their lack of respect for their customers--I truly felt like just flipping them off for their rudeness. Next time, I'm going on Mission St. to find a place with manners and better food.

excerpts: I got the super carne asada burrito for $7 plus tax.
The size was ridiculously small and the taste was just okay.
I guess they cut down the size to make up for the slow business.
super.author: Edmund W.
super.review: I passed this place by accident and went inside  because there used to be a great burrito place on Mission and 1st Street with the same name so I thought this place might be affiliated.  I got the super carne asada burrito for $7 plus tax.  The size was ridiculously small and the taste was just okay.  I guess they cut down the size to make up for the slow business.

excerpts: The super spicy salsa is what makes this place stand out.
Of course, I'm always a fan of a taqueria that has wheat, tomato and spinach tortilla options as well.
Super friendly staff too.
AND they have the Snapple from the Celebrity Apprentice, which I've been unable to find anywhere else.
Whoop!
super.author: Amy C.
super.review: The only thing I've had here is the burritos, but they are so money I can't pass up the opportunity to eat one in favor of ordering something else.  The super spicy salsa is what makes this place stand out.  Of course, I'm always a fan of a taqueria that has wheat, tomato and spinach tortilla options as well.  Super friendly staff too.  AND they have the Snapple from the Celebrity Apprentice, which I've been unable to find anywhere else.  Whoop!

excerpts: I like the chicken super burrito, but above all, the pupusas.
The hubby prefers the ham sandwich with everything you can imagine in it.
By far, I think the food is better in this location.
super.author: Kui T.
super.review: I like the chicken super burrito, but above all, the pupusas.  The hubby prefers the ham sandwich with everything you can imagine in it.  By far, I think the food is better in this location.

excerpts: Delicious chicken fajita super burritos served with a friendly smile every time.
super.author: Sneaks N. Beat S.
super.review: Delicious chicken fajita super burritos served with a friendly smile every time.

excerpts: I definitely have other places I prefer, but the siren song of the super chicken burrito still lures me to the corner of 20th and Folsom.
This may have been the first SF burrito place
I tried back in 1976 (or possibly the long lost Antojitos Mexicanos on Mission)
when I first came here, so I have fond memories.
Like how I mastered eating a burrito while bicycling to my busboy gig at MacArthur Park from SF State.
What a skill!
So, I admit this is no La Corneta, the food still hits a spot for old timers like me.
Well, actually only the chicken burrito hits a spot.
It is the sauce and the blending of the ingredients in the "super" that does it for me.

As an aside, La Taqueria, on Mission near 25th, does a great taco (through all the various owners...although I must admit I like the the Warrior's fans the best, the folks who ran it in the 80's and 90's...the wife of the couple would hold up the line while Purvis Short was at the line, god what dedication to the cause of bay area hoops!)
But, I, in  a major way digress.
The burritos at La Taqueria suck!
If you are in SF you must use rice!
Go to El Faro.
Try this burrito.
This is the prototype, the gutbomb that made our fair city the burrito capitol of the world.
super.author: James T.
super.review: This is a tricky one. I definitely have other places I prefer, but the siren song of the super chicken burrito still lures me to the corner of 20th and Folsom. This may have been the first SF burrito place I tried back in 1976 (or possibly the long lost Antojitos Mexicanos on Mission) when I first came here, so I have fond memories. Like how I mastered eating a burrito while bicycling to my busboy gig at MacArthur Park from SF State. What a skill! So, I admit this is no La Corneta, the food still hits a spot for old timers like me. Well, actually only the chicken burrito hits a spot. It is the sauce and the blending of the ingredients in the "super" that does it for me. As an aside, La Taqueria, on Mission near 25th, does a great taco (through all the various owners...although I must admit I like the the Warrior's fans the best, the folks who ran it in the 80's and 90's...the wife of the couple would hold up the line while Purvis Short was at the line, god what dedication to the cause of bay area hoops!) But, I, in  a major way digress. The burritos at La Taqueria suck!  If you are in SF you must use rice! Go to El Faro.Try this burrito.  This is the prototype, the gutbomb that made our fair city the burrito capitol of the world.

excerpts: the super quesadilla is decent though.
super.author: Joe G.
super.review:
i hate steamed tortillas in my burritos, so this place isn't so good. the super quesadilla is decent though. 

and in reference to one of the earlier reviews, every time i've gone they have had black beans *shrugs*

excerpts: She got a vegetarian super one, I got carne asada super no sour cream.
They were just all liquid (and hers was like pure sour cream)
, there was no substance, and the carne asada was gristly; it's turned me off meat anew (a good thing i guess..).
As a final insult, they gave us NO chips.
They had them there.
We could have asked I guess
but it was just so weird that we wouldn't get any
, I remember coming here before and getting them.
I think maybe they aren't doing so well
and that's what's with the cutting corners.
who knows, but i couldn't finish this burrito, the stub, hours later when i was hungry again, and that's something that just does not happen with me and burritos around these parts.
The gristly part seriously made me wanna hurl.
super.author: Kate F.
super.review: Well my roommate and I went here around 6 pm on a Sunday, and they seemed like they were wanting to close, but I gotta say, the burritos were really disappointing. She got a vegetarian super one, I got carne asada super no sour cream. They were just all liquid (and hers was like pure sour cream), there was no substance, and the carne asada was gristly; it's turned me off meat anew (a good thing i guess..). As a final insult, they gave us NO chips. They had them there. We could have asked I guess but it was just so weird that we wouldn't get any, I remember coming here before and getting them. I think maybe they aren't doing so well and that's what's with the cutting corners. who knows, but i couldn't finish this burrito, the stub, hours later when i was hungry again, and that's something that just does not happen with me and burritos around these parts. The gristly part seriously made me wanna hurl.

excerpts: They have standard menu of burritos with choice of meats,   nachos, tacos, sandwiches, horchata, and pupusas.
They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.
I would come to this place again.
pupusas.author: Hiroshi K.
pupusas.review: This place makes good burritos.  The super burrito with steak is pretty good.  It comes with salsa and some chips. Service is fast and efficient.  Their pupusa is good. The Horchata is good.  They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.  They have standard menu of burritos with choice of meats,   nachos, tacos, sandwiches, horchata, and pupusas. They accepted my Scout Mob coupon.  I would come to this place again.

excerpts: Got pupusas.
They were terrible.
Nowhere near fresh, clearly micorwaved, dry on the inside, soggy on the outside, and tasting vaguely of foam rubber.
Even the curtido (Latin slaw) couldn't save the pupusa, mostly because it too sucked.
El Faro, you suck.
You are a waste of a prime corner location.
And you better hope that high school next door doesn't close.
Or that they outlaw 4Loko.
pupusas.author: Eric S.
pupusas.review:
As my roommate most astutely pointed out, this place stays open for one reason: the high school next door.  Fourteen year olds hopped up on 4Loko too broke/drunk to care if their $5 burrito tastes like it was microwaved 1 hour ago.
I've been here twice.  It's across the street, literally.  The first time I had an al pastor burrito.  It was cold, made poorly, and the taste was far below average.  I then decided to give El Faro one more chance.  Got pupusas.  They were terrible.  Nowhere near fresh, clearly micorwaved, dry on the inside, soggy on the outside, and tasting vaguely of foam rubber.  Even the curtido (Latin slaw) couldn't save the pupusa, mostly because it too sucked.   
El Faro, you suck.  You are a waste of a prime corner location.  And you better hope that high school next door doesn't close.  Or that they outlaw 4Loko.

excerpts: and yeah... the pupusas are pupusarific!
The Latino Day parade is coming up and I can't wait for my El Faro visit!
pupusas.author: Michelle B.
pupusas.review:
I've been coming to this place since I was a fetus and I'm hoping that they have an El Faro in heaven too because this place is awesome =)

To me and mi familia, nothing beats an old school El Faro burrito... They're massive and filled with flavor. I like to complement my pollo super  burrito with some chocolate milk... mmmm. The burritos are so juicy that you have to be careful not to leave any burrito evidence on your clothes. 

The restaurant itself has looked the same all of my life and i truly appreciate its consistency! So it's not fancy and maybe it doesn't cater to demanding non-Latino sensibilities, but it leaves some charm in between all of the mission's renovated buildings. Eat in your car if the orange and brown colors are that bothersome... the point is, just eat one of their awesome burritos!

and yeah... the pupusas are pupusarific! The Latino Day parade is coming up and I can't wait for my El Faro visit!

excerpts: Also...they've got pupusas!
I love me some pupusas...and while they aren't freshly made (they've got to nuke them), they are still tasty!
pupusas.author: Jennifer G.
pupusas.review: 5 stars for the El Faro burritos that live on in my memory.  Gloppy beans, under seasoned rice, fake guacamole and they skimp on the meat...but by golly, those puppies are HUGE.  I'll agree that these aren't the best in the city, but perhaps it's an acquired taste.  Also...they've got pupusas!  I love me some pupusas...and while they aren't freshly made (they've got to nuke them), they are still tasty!

excerpts: I like the chicken super burrito, but above all, the pupusas.
The hubby prefers the ham sandwich with everything you can imagine in it.
By far, I think the food is better in this location.
pupusas.author: Kui T.
pupusas.review: I like the chicken super burrito, but above all, the pupusas.  The hubby prefers the ham sandwich with everything you can imagine in it.  By far, I think the food is better in this location.
